Detailed Description

seDRMBase is the base class for the DRM-specific classes.

All the DRM-specific classes are derived from seDRMBase. This class has very specific tasks tailored to the management of the get/set of object fields.

DRM abstract classes are also provided as part of the DRM hierarchy. These are useful, for example, as parameters to general functions that can operate on derived types. They are also useful when you want to get a base class and later work on its specific type. For example: 

seDRMColour colour;

poly.getComponent( colour );

if ( colour.isA( SE_CLS_DRM_INLINE_COLOUR ) )
{
    seDRMInlineColour inline_colour( colour );
    ...
}
else if ( colour.isA( SE_CLS_DRM_COLOUR_INDEX ) )
{
    seDRMColourIndex colour_index( colour );
    ...
}

Derived classes use the static methods declared by this class, along with the macros above to perform the get/set of fields.

Warren Macchi
